title: 113_hr1676
content: The Act is titled the "Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area Establishment Act" and designates the Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area. The Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area, encompassing approximately 188,000 acres in San Bernardino County, California, is designated for public recreation (including off-highway vehicle use, camping, and hiking) and natural resources conservation. The Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area, covering 188,000 acres in San Bernardino County, California, is designated for public recreation and natural resources conservation. The area is withdrawn from all forms of appropriation under public land laws, subject to valid existing rights. Limited biannual Marine Corps Air Ground Combat Center Twentynine Palms use of Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area. The Secretary of the Interior authorizes the Secretary of the Navy to use Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area for military purposes twice a year for up to 60 days, including training for Marine air-ground task forces, live-fire exercises, equipment development, and other defense-related activities. The Secretary of the Navy must consult with the Secretary of the Interior for optimal military use timing at Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area to minimize interference with nonmilitary activities. Public awareness and participation in the selection process must be ensured. Advance notice of public land closures for military use is required, and safety measures are in place during authorized biannual periods. The Secretary of the Navy must consult with the Secretary of the Interior for optimal military use timing at Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area. Public awareness and participation in the selection process must be ensured. Authorized biannual periods require the presence of range safety officers for safety. The Secretary of the Navy shall prohibit the use of dud-producing ordnance in military training. An implementing agreement between the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of the Navy is required, with provisions for periodic review and integration of management plans. The Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of the Navy delegate authority to civilian law enforcement personnel of the Department of the Navy to enforce laws related to natural and cultural resources, fish, and wildlife. Resources are shared for efficient land management. Any military agreement for Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area must end by March 31, 2039. TRANSFER OF ADMINISTRATIVE JURISDICTION, SOUTHERN STUDY AREA, MARINE CORPS AIR GROUND COMBAT CENTER TWENTYNINE PALMS, CALIFORNIA. The Secretary of the Interior will transfer approximately 20,000 acres of public land in San Bernardino County, California to the Secretary of the Navy for military use at the Marine Corps Air Ground Combat Center Twentynine Palms. The legal description and map of the transferred land will be published in the Federal Register. The legal description and map of the public land to be transferred to the Secretary of the Navy will have the same force of law as if included in the Act, with the Secretary of the Interior able to correct errors. The Secretary of the Navy will reimburse any costs incurred by the Secretary of the Interior for this transfer. SEC. 5. WATER RIGHTS. This section clarifies that the Act does not establish a reservation of water rights for the United States on transferred lands, and water appropriation must comply with State law. It also states that previously acquired or reserved water rights by the United States are not affected by this Act.
